candidates.name: Andrew MacPherson
candidates.why_elect: My career as a rural veterinarian along with subsequent CEO and Board directorship roles provides me with a range of perspectives on a variety of subjects. My veterinary work enhanced my empathy and listening skills enabling me to engage with most people, I want to see prosperity for all.
candidates.why_stand: My skills and experience will add value to the WRC, this region has been good to me. I want to give back by using my governance skills to build a more vibrant community for everyone's benefit. We are significant part of the NZ economy which I want to build.

candidates.name: Stuart Kneebone
candidates.why_elect: I'm friendly and approachable, with a strong sense of community responsibility. I'm pragmatic, with a considered and evidence based approach towards decision making, focused on doing the right thing for the region and its communities.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate about our region, and the role of the regional council to ensure it remains a great place to live, work and play. I want to do my bit to ensure the decisions we make as a community are meeting the best interests of current and future generations.

candidates.name: Dan Armstrong
candidates.why_elect: Having spent nearly all my life in the King Country and Waipā, I understand the challenges that face us. Having worked in the region, supported community grounds and gained some governance experience I'm eager to bring experienced, community/critical minded abilities to the council table.
candidates.why_stand: I want locals to have someone at the council table that cares about the environment and climate change as much as they do—that's why I'm standing.
